issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When [~shaon] ran a Windows instance soon after registering it, NC failed to download the image and wedged itself.

The relevant parts of nc.log are:

{code}
2013-10-30 11:11:09  INFO 000002508 doRunInstance            | [i-D6F5424D] running instance cores=2 disk=30 memory=4096 vlan=548 
net=9 priMAC=D0:0D:D6:F5:42:4D privIp=172.28.162.41 plat=windows kernel=(null) ramdisk=(null)
2013-10-30 11:11:09 DEBUG 000002508 vbr_legacy               | [i-D6F5424D]                VBR[0] type=ephemeral id=none dev=sdb s
ize=15032385536 format=none none
2013-10-30 11:11:09 DEBUG 000002508 vbr_legacy               | [i-D6F5424D]                VBR[1] type=machine id=emi-50143F8D dev
=sda size=17179869184 format=none walrus://windows2008/windows2008_3_4_0.img.manifest.xml
2013-10-30 11:11:09 DEBUG 000002508 change_state             | [i-D6F5424D] state change for instance: Unknown -> Staging (Pending
)

....

dows2008_3_4_0.img.manifest.xml

fields.summary: NC hangs inside get_blkid (e.g., during launch or migration)

comments.body: Today [~shaon] saw this again, this time during migration. The similarity is `get_blkid` invocation in the stack trace. It appears that occasionally shell-out to `blkid` command hangs indefinitely. The band-aid solution is to do the shell-out with a timeout and, possibly, retry it once or twice.
Hopefully the current solution solves the problem.

Verified with couple of windows/linux run/migration.
